alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Broome and southeastern Tioga Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Corners, or over Endicott, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Conklin, Maine, Port Dickinson, Newark Valley, Greater Binghamton Airport and Apalachin. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 2 and 7. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 65 and 75. Interstate 88 between 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
